com.px100systems.data.core

Class DatabaseStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.px100systems.data.core.DatabaseStorage
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InMemoryDatabase, TraditionalDatabase

    public abstract class DatabaseStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    Persistent database: whether in-memory with write-behind/write-through or traditional one.
    Responsible for scanning the specified entity class packages and registering their SerializationDefinitions.

    Configuration
    • tenantLoader - responsible for loading tenant configuration (can be null for non multi-tenant apps).
    • initializer - a "one-time" development mode parameter - a callback, that populates the database after it is wiped out (on server startup). if initializer is specified, the database schema is being wiped out on the startup - storage provider responsibility.
    • baseEntityPackages - the packages to scan for Entity subclasses - to build persistence units (maps).
    • runtimeStorage - in-memory cache needed for ID generators, etc.
    Author:
    Alex Rogachevsky

    • Method Detail

      • setRuntimeStorage

        public void setRuntimeStorage(RuntimeStorage runtimeStorage)
        Data grid storage - required for runtime (aka "transient") state like HTTP session management, global counters, etc. even when using traditional on-disk database e.g. Mongo - see TraditionalDatabase. Responsible for full data persistence when using the data grid as primary storage - see InMemoryDatabase.
        Parameters:
        runtimeStorage - Data grid base storage

      • setBaseEntityPackages

        public void setBaseEntityPackages(java.util.List<java.lang.String> baseEntityPackages)
        Mandatory list of packages where database entities are expected. Entities need to subclass Entity and be serializable: Portable for Hazelcast, Externalizable for Ignite, and just normal POJOs for Mongo. Entities can only have non-transient fields (and serialized getters) of String, Long, Integer, Double, Date, and Boolean types. They can also have Lists and Sets of sub-objects which fields are limited to thsoe specified above. Sub-objects are handled by SerializationDefintion and don't need to implement Portable or Externalizable. Typically it'd be a one direct abstract subclass of Entity that implements those, and then real entities derived from it.
        Parameters:
        baseEntityPackages - list of Java class packages

      • setTenantLoader

        public void setTenantLoader(TenantLoader tenantLoader)
        Tenant loader for multi-tenant systems. Muli-tenant systems store different tenant data in different "units": Mongo documents, Hazelcast maps, and Ignite caches. See Entity.tenantId field for details. It is always zero for single-tenant systems.
        Parameters:
        tenantLoader - tenant loader.

      • setInitializer

        public void setInitializer(DbInitializer initializer)
        Database initializer - if specified, the underlying database provider will wipe out and recreate its schema on startup before invoking it.
        Parameters:
        initializer - initializer callback/lambda

      • transaction

        public Transaction transaction(java.lang.Integer tenantId)
                        throws DataStorageException
        Database "transaction" for a specified tenant (pass 0 in single-tenant projects).
        A transaction does not lock anything until it is actiually committed (see Transaction.commit()). Only at that time all accumulated inerts, updates, and deletes are executed at once. This way it is a simulated pessimistic, read-committed transaction, especially for non-transactional providers like Mongo. Mongo provider does attempt to recover/rollback by storing the before-transaction state of all entity beans enqueued for saving. Once committed, the transaction cannot be reused, however a new one can be started from the old one - see Transaction.transaction(java.lang.Integer)
        Parameters:
        tenantId - tenant ID
        Returns:
        transaction
        Throws:
        DataStorageException

      • init

        protected abstract void init(java.util.List<DatabaseStorage.EntityInfo> entities,
                             boolean initializeData)
        Internal method responsible for creating/syncing all entities and indexes on startup. initializeData is relevant for in-memory providers - tells it to reset the disk storage: recreate schemas, etc.
        Parameters:
        entities - a list of recognized (scanned) entities with indexes and otehr metadata.
        initializeData - whether to wipe out the database.

        Graceful shutdown. Used internally.

        Get entity by its Long ID. Internal method used by Transaction.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity class
        Parameters:
        unitName - a unit name is typically the entity name + tenantId
        cls - entity class
        id - entity ID
        Returns:
        entity bean or null

                              Criteria criteria)
        Count entites matching some criteria or all if no criteria was specified. Used internally by Transaction.
        Parameters:

        cls - entity class
        criteria - filter criteria. Can be null
        Returns:
        the number of foudn entities

      • search

        protected abstract <T> java.util.List<T> search(java.lang.String unitName,
                                                java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                                Criteria criteria,
                                                java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy,
                                                java.lang.Integer limit)
        Query with a limit. Used internally by Transaction.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity class
        Parameters:
        unitName - a unit name is typically the entity name + tenantId
        cls - entity class - make sure the exact concrete class is specified and not a superclass
        criteria - filter - can be null to get all entities
        orderBy - - list of SQL-like strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        limit - mandatory limit
        Returns:
        a list of entity beans

      • search

        protected abstract <T> EntityCursor<T> search(java.lang.String unitName,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                                              Criteria criteria,
                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> orderBy)
        Query without a limit. Used internally by Transaction.
        Type Parameters:
        T - entity class
        Parameters:
        unitName - a unit name is typically the entity name + tenantId
        cls - entity class - make sure the exact concrete class is specified and not a superclass
        criteria - filter - can be null to get all entities
        orderBy - - list of SQL-like strings e.g. {"field1 ASC", "field2 DESC", "field3"}
        Returns:
        a closeable cursor (always use try/finally to close)

      • save

        protected abstract java.util.List<EntityDescriptor> save(java.util.List<StoredBean> inserts,
                                                         java.util.List<StoredBean> updates,
                                                         java.util.List<Delete> deletes,
                                                         java.util.List<InPlaceUpdate<?>> inPlaceUpdates)
                                                  throws DataStorageException
        Saving the changes transactionally. Used internally by Transaction.commit().
        Parameters:
        inserts - a list of beans to insert
        updates - a list of changed beans to save
        deletes - a list of deletes - eitehr bean IDs or some Conditions to find and delete entities
        inPlaceUpdates - a list of callbacks to execute in-place updates via entry processors. Relevant to in-memory grids only.
        Returns:
        a list of deleted entity descriptors: unit name, class, and ID. Since we already know inserts and updates (including in-pace ines), only deletes are not known until the actual execution since they can be Condition-based. All three kinds of operations need to be passed to persistance servers responsiblke for write-behind - immediately after the transaction.
        Throws:
        DataStorageException

      • isActive

        public abstract boolean isActive()
        Active and healthy e.g. no stalled persistence, etc. Used internally.
        Returns:
        if the dartabase is active

      • afterSave

        protected abstract void afterSave(java.util.Date now,
                                  java.util.List<StoredBean> allInserts,
                                  java.util.List<StoredBean> allUpdates,
                                  java.util.List<EntityDescriptor> deletes,
                                  java.util.List<InPlaceUpdate<?>> inPlaceUpdates)
                           throws DataStorageException
        Internal wite-behind implementation - relevant for data grids only, not traditional databases (Mongo).
        Parameters:
        now - current time
        allInserts - inserts
        allUpdates - updates
        deletes - deleted bean IDs
        inPlaceUpdates - in-place updates
        Throws:
        DataStorageException
